briefdescription.para: Deinitializes the SPIx peripheral registers to their default reset values (Affects also the I2Ss).

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the SPIx peripheral according to the specified parameters in the SPI_InitStruct.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.
pointer to a SPI_InitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified SPI peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the SPIx peripheral according to the specified parameters in the I2S_InitStruct.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral (configured in I2S mode).
pointer to an I2S_InitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified SPI peripheral configured in I2S mode.

simplesect.para: The function calculates the optimal prescaler needed to obtain the most accurate audio frequency (depending on the I2S clock source, the PLL values and the product configuration). But in case the prescaler value is greater than 511, the default value (0x02) will be configured instead. *

briefdescription.para: Fills each SPI_InitStruct member with its default value.

parameterdescription.para: : pointer to a SPI_InitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

briefdescription.para: Fills each I2S_InitStruct member with its default value.

parameterdescription.para: : pointer to a I2S_InitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables the specified SPI peripheral.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.
new state of the SPIx peripheral. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables the specified SPI peripheral (in I2S mode).

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.
new state of the SPIx peripheral. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables the specified SPI/I2S interrupts.

parameterdescription.para:
where x can be
1, 2 or 3 in SPI mode
2 or 3 in I2S mode

specifies the SPI/I2S interrupt source to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be one of the following values:
SPI_I2S_IT_TXE: Tx buffer empty interrupt mask
SPI_I2S_IT_RXNE: Rx buffer not empty interrupt mask
SPI_I2S_IT_ERR: Error interrupt mask
new state of the specified SPI/I2S interrupt. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables the SPIx/I2Sx DMA interface.

parameterdescription.para:
where x can be
1, 2 or 3 in SPI mode
2 or 3 in I2S mode

specifies the SPI/I2S DMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
SPI_I2S_DMAReq_Tx: Tx buffer DMA transfer request
SPI_I2S_DMAReq_Rx: Rx buffer DMA transfer request
new state of the selected SPI/I2S DMA transfer request. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

briefdescription.para: Transmits a Data through the SPIx/I2Sx peripheral.

parameterdescription.para:
where x can be
1, 2 or 3 in SPI mode
2 or 3 in I2S mode
: Data to be transmitted.

briefdescription.para: Returns the most recent received data by the SPIx/I2Sx peripheral.

parameterdescription.para:
where x can be
1, 2 or 3 in SPI mode
2 or 3 in I2S mode
value of the received data.

briefdescription.para: Configures internally by software the NSS pin for the selected SPI.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.

specifies the SPI NSS internal state. This parameter can be one of the following values:
SPI_NSSInternalSoft_Set: Set NSS pin internally
SPI_NSSInternalSoft_Reset: Reset NSS pin internally

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables the SS output for the selected SPI.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.
new state of the SPIx SS output. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

briefdescription.para: Configures the data size for the selected SPI.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.

specifies the SPI data size. This parameter can be one of the following values:
SPI_DataSize_16b: Set data frame format to 16bit
SPI_DataSize_8b: Set data frame format to 8bit

briefdescription.para: Transmit the SPIx CRC value.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables the CRC value calculation of the transferred bytes.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.
new state of the SPIx CRC value calculation. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

briefdescription.para: Returns the transmit or the receive CRC register value for the specified SPI.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.

specifies the CRC register to be read. This parameter can be one of the following values:
SPI_CRC_Tx: Selects Tx CRC register
SPI_CRC_Rx: Selects Rx CRC register
selected CRC register value..

briefdescription.para: Returns the CRC Polynomial register value for the specified SPI.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.
CRC Polynomial register value.

briefdescription.para: Selects the data transfer direction in bi-directional mode for the specified SPI.

parameterdescription.para: where x can be 1, 2 or 3 to select the SPI peripheral.

specifies the data transfer direction in bi-directional mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
SPI_Direction_Tx: Selects Tx transmission direction
SPI_Direction_Rx: Selects Rx receive direction

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the specified SPI/I2S flag is set or not.

parameterdescription.para:
where x can be
1, 2 or 3 in SPI mode
2 or 3 in I2S mode

specifies the SPI/I2S flag to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
SPI_I2S_FLAG_TXE: Transmit buffer empty flag.
SPI_I2S_FLAG_RXNE: Receive buffer not empty flag.
SPI_I2S_FLAG_BSY: Busy flag.
SPI_I2S_FLAG_OVR: Overrun flag.
SPI_FLAG_MODF: Mode Fault flag.
SPI_FLAG_CRCERR: CRC Error flag.
I2S_FLAG_UDR: Underrun Error flag.
I2S_FLAG_CHSIDE: Channel Side flag.
new state of SPI_I2S_FLAG (SET or RESET).

briefdescription.para: Clears the SPIx CRC Error (CRCERR) flag.

parameterdescription.para:
where x can be
1, 2 or 3 in SPI mode
specifies the SPI flag to clear. This function clears only CRCERR flag.

listitem.para: OVR (OverRun error) flag is cleared by software sequence: a read operation to SPI_DR register (SPI_I2S_ReceiveData()) followed by a read operation to SPI_SR register (SPI_I2S_GetFlagStatus()).
UDR (UnderRun error) flag is cleared by a read operation to SPI_SR register (SPI_I2S_GetFlagStatus()).

MODF (Mode Fault) flag is cleared by software sequence: a read/write operation to SPI_SR register (SPI_I2S_GetFlagStatus()) followed by a write operation to SPI_CR1 register (SPI_Cmd() to enable the SPI).

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the specified SPI/I2S interrupt has occurred or not.

parameterdescription.para:
where x can be
1, 2 or 3 in SPI mode
2 or 3 in I2S mode

specifies the SPI/I2S interrupt source to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
SPI_I2S_IT_TXE: Transmit buffer empty interrupt.
SPI_I2S_IT_RXNE: Receive buffer not empty interrupt.
SPI_I2S_IT_OVR: Overrun interrupt.
SPI_IT_MODF: Mode Fault interrupt.
SPI_IT_CRCERR: CRC Error interrupt.
I2S_IT_UDR: Underrun Error interrupt.
new state of SPI_I2S_IT (SET or RESET).

briefdescription.para: Clears the SPIx CRC Error (CRCERR) interrupt pending bit.

parameterdescription.para:
where x can be
1, 2 or 3 in SPI mode
specifies the SPI interrupt pending bit to clear. This function clears only CRCERR interrupt pending bit.

listitem.para: OVR (OverRun Error) interrupt pending bit is cleared by software sequence: a read operation to SPI_DR register (SPI_I2S_ReceiveData()) followed by a read operation to SPI_SR register (SPI_I2S_GetITStatus()).
UDR (UnderRun Error) interrupt pending bit is cleared by a read operation to SPI_SR register (SPI_I2S_GetITStatus()).

MODF (Mode Fault) interrupt pending bit is cleared by software sequence: a read/write operation to SPI_SR register (SPI_I2S_GetITStatus()) followed by a write operation to SPI_CR1 register (SPI_Cmd() to enable the SPI).

briefdescription.para: This file provides all the SPI firmware functions.

detaileddescription.para:
MCD Application Team
V3.5.0
11-March-2011
THE PRESENT FIRMWARE WHICH IS FOR GUIDANCE ONLY AIMS AT PROVIDING CUSTOMERS WITH CODING INFORMATION REGARDING THEIR PRODUCTS IN ORDER FOR THEM TO SAVE TIME. AS A RESULT, STMICROELECTRONICS SHALL NOT BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WITH RESPECT TO ANY CLAIMS ARISING FROM THE CONTENT OF SUCH FIRMWARE AND/OR THE USE MADE BY CUSTOMERS OF THE CODING INFORMATION CONTAINED HEREIN IN CONNECTION WITH THEIR PRODUCTS.
